entries.meaning: Embodied in bread, especially in the bread of the Eucharist.
examples: And then, as we have God verily incarnate for our redemption, so should we have him, impanate

verbs.description: impanate (third-person singular simple present impanates, present participle impanating, simple past and past participle impanated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To embody in bread, especially in the bread of the Eucharist.
